      • sliceSegmentsAtY

        public ArrayList<LineSegment2D> sliceSegmentsAtY(float theY)
        Slice the stored geometry composed of triangles at the y plane. This returns no connected paths, but a list of unrelated line segments. To get connected paths, you might want to use @see PathSlicer.slice
        Parameters:
        theY -
        Returns:
        a list of 2D paths

      • sliceFacesWithPlane

        public static List<LineSegment2D> sliceFacesWithPlane(List<TriangleFace> theFaces,
                                      float theY)
        Slice a geometry composed of triangles at the y plane. This returns no connected paths, but a list of unrelated line segments. To get connected paths, you might want to use @see PathSlicer.slice
        Parameters:
        theFaces -
        theY -
        Returns:

        public static LineSegment2D sliceTriangleWithPlane(TriangleFace theFace,
                                   float theY)
        Slice a triangle with a defined y plane.
        Parameters:
        theFace - a triangle face
        theY - y plane
        Returns:
        null or the resulting line segment.

      • mergeSegmentsToPaths

        public static List<ContourPath> mergeSegmentsToPaths(List<LineSegment2D> theSegments)
        Combines a list of unconnected line segments and turns them into connected paths. This is a rather workaround, because Processing does not represent meshes in a connected way. All information on how faces are connected is lost in progress.
        Parameters:
        theSegments -
        Returns:
